text:
Raskolnikov stood in the doorway, hesitating. 

Nastasya whispered, “Don’t disturb him. Let him sleep.” 

“Quite so,” Razumihin replied. They closed the door softly.

Raskolnikov opened his eyes, hands clasped behind his head. 

“Who is that man? Where was he?” 

He shivered, thoughts racing. 

“Did Nikolay find a clue?” 

A fly buzzed by. 

“Is it possible?” he wondered. 

He felt weak, bitterly smiling. 

“How could I take up an axe?” 

“Ah, but I did know!” he whispered. 

He paused, lost in thought. 

“Real masters storm cities, laugh at the dead.”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov reflects on his weakness and the consequences of his actions, questioning the nature of guilt and the possibility of being above moral laws.
